alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 23 at 4:16PM EST until February 24 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...The Flood Watch is for the Kentucky counties of Johnson, Martin, Laurel, McCreary, Pulaski, Rockcastle, Wayne, Whitley, Bell, Breathitt, Clay, Floyd, Harlan, Jackson, Knott, Knox, Lee, Leslie, Letcher, Magoffin, Owsley, Perry, Pike, and Wolfe. * WHEN...The Flood Watch is in effect from Midnight EST tonight through early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
